meanings.def: a separate section of a book, usually with a number or title
examples: to read/write a chapter
He devotes an entire chapter to this topic.
I've just finished Chapter 3.
I read chapter after chapter of the book.
in a chapter in the previous/next/first/last chapter
in a later chapter
There is a useful summary at the end of the chapter.
chapter of something the final chapter of her autobiography
the opening chapter of the book
chapter in something the most interesting chapter in the book
chapter on something Have you read the chapter on the legal system?
His influence on other writers will be discussed in the next chapter.
I read the first few chapters and then got bored.
The author devotes two chapters to language acquisition.
This chapter covers money and banking.
a chapter on the city's architecture

meanings.def: a period of time in a person’s life or in history
examples: a difficult chapter in our country’s history
Her return to Kansas ended a particularly unhappy chapter in her life.

meanings.def: all the priests of a cathedral or members of a religious community
examples: a meeting of the dean and chapter

meanings.def: a local branch of a society, club, etc.
examples: the local chapter of the Rotary club

meanings.def: the exact details of something, especially the exact place where particular information may be found
examples: I can't give chapter and verse, but that's the rough outline of our legal position.

meanings.def: a series of unpleasant events caused by bad luck
examples: The whole affair has been a chapter of accidents from start to finish.
